    • Constructor Detail

      • NutchServer

        public NutchServer()
        Public constructor which accepts the port we wish to run the server on as well as the logging granularity. If the latter option is not provided via main(String[]) then it defaults to 'INFO' however best attempts should always be made to specify a logging level.<br> NutchServer can be run as secure. restapi.auth property should be set to BASIC, DIGEST or SSL at nutch-site.xml to enable HTTP basic authentication, digest authentication or SSL when communicating with RESTAPI. Set restapi.auth.username and restapi.auth.password properties at nutch-site.xml to configure credentials when BASIC or DIGEST authentication is used. Set restapi.auth.ssl.storepath, restapi.auth.ssl.storepass and restapi.auth.ssl.keypass when SSL is used.
        See Also:
        AuthenticationTypeEnum

      • NutchServer

        public NutchServer(RAMConfManager ramConfManager)
        Public constructor which accepts RAMConfManager RAM configuration manager and the port we wish to run the server on as well as the logging granularity. If the latter option is not provided via main(String[]) then it defaults to 'INFO' however best attempts should always be made to specify a logging level.<br> NutchServer can be run as secure. restapi.auth property should be set to BASIC, DIGEST or SSL at nutch-site.xml to enable HTTP basic authentication, digest authentication or SSL when communicating with RESTAPI. Set restapi.auth.username and restapi.auth.password properties at nutch-site.xml to configure credentials when BASIC or DIGEST authentication is used. Set restapi.auth.ssl.storepath, restapi.auth.ssl.storepass and restapi.auth.ssl.keypass when SSL is used.
        Parameters:
        ramConfManager - RAMConfManager
        See Also:
        AuthenticationTypeEnum

      • NutchServer

        public NutchServer(RAMConfManager ramConfManager,
                   java.lang.String confId)
        Public constructor which accepts RAMConfManager RAM configuration manager, a configuration id to use from RAM configuration manager and the port we wish to run the server on as well as the logging granularity. If the latter option is not provided via main(String[]) then it defaults to 'INFO' however best attempts should always be made to specify a logging level.<br> NutchServer can be run as secure. restapi.auth property should be set to BASIC, DIGEST or SSL at nutch-site.xml to enable HTTP basic authentication, digest authentication or SSL when communicating with RESTAPI. Set restapi.auth.username and restapi.auth.password properties at nutch-site.xml to configure credentials when BASIC or DIGEST authentication is used. Set restapi.auth.ssl.storepath, restapi.auth.ssl.storepass and restapi.auth.ssl.keypass when SSL is used.
        Parameters:
        ramConfManager - RAMConfManager
        confId - active configuration id
        See Also:
        AuthenticationTypeEnum

      • getClasses

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<?>> getClasses()
        Get a set of root resource and provider classes. The default lifecycle for resource class instances is per-request. The default lifecycle for providers is singleton.
        Overrides:
        getClasses in class javax.ws.rs.core.Application
        Returns:
        a set of root resource and provider classes. Returning null is equivalent to returning an empty set.

        public boolean isRunning()
        Convenience method to determine whether a Nutch server is running.
        Returns:
        true if a server instance is running.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the Nutch server printing some logging to the log file.

      • canStop

        public boolean canStop(boolean force)
        Safety and convenience method to determine whether or not it is safe to shut down the server. We make this assertion by consulting the getJobMgr() for a list of jobs with JobInfo.state equal to 'RUNNING'.
        Parameters:
        force - ignore running tasks
        Returns:
        true if there are no jobs running or false if there are jobs with running state.

      • stop

        public boolean stop(boolean force)
        Stop the Nutch server.
        Parameters:
        force - boolean method to effectively kill jobs regardless of state.
        Returns:
        true if no server is running or if the shutdown was successful. Return false if there are running jobs and the force switch has not been activated.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Main method for NutchServer to run via command line.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments for log level, stopping the Server and port.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception
